identificationModule.briefTitle: Validation of Nexfin Cardiac Output in Elderly Patients With Hip Fracture
identificationModule.officialTitle: Validation of the Nexfin Non-invasive Cardiac Output Monitor in Patients Undergoing Hip Fracture Repair

collaborators.name: Brighton and Sussex University Hospitals NHS Trust

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Measurement of how much blood the heart pumps may be useful in guiding how much intravenous fluid to give patients during surgery. The current monitors either require special drips (arterial and/or central lines) or a probe inserted into the oesophagus (food pipe) which may limit their use. Newer monitors are available which are completely non-invasive and seem to work well in younger patients. Patients with hip fracture are elderly and frail. The investigators wish to see whether the newer non-invasive monitor works well enough compared to the current monitors in this group of patients. If it does this may allow more of these patients to be monitored in this way.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The investigators wish to compare the accuracy of the newer, non-invasive monitor (Nexfin) against a more established minimally invasive monitor (LiDCO). The LiDCO has a calibration system which allows the absolute accuracy of the Nexfin to be established.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Bias and limits of agreement of Nexfin recorded cardiac output compared with LiDCOplus
primaryOutcomes.description: Analysis of agreement between Nexfin cardiac output and the calibrated cardiac output measured by LiDCOplus
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During anaesthesia period of surgery - measurements will be complete within 30 minutes of starting anaesthesia

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Bias and limits of agreement for change in cardiac output measured by Nexfin compared with LiDCO
secondaryOutcomes.description: Comparison of relative changes in cardiac output recorded by Nexfin and LiDCO in response to intra-anaesthesia / intra-operative events (fluid administration, drug administration)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During anaesthesia period of surgery - measurements will be complete within 30 minutes of starting anaesthesia

secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of time during anaesthesia and surgery when a valid signal is obtained from the Nexfin device.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Adverse events associated with Nexfin monitor
secondaryOutcomes.description: Recording of adverse events associated with use of the Nexfin monitor
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Intra-operative - average duration about one hour

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Aged over 80
* Able to give their own informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* Severe valvular heart disease
* Taking lithium
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Elderly patients undergoing surgical repair of hip fracture

overallOfficials.name: Iain K Moppett, DM FRCA MRCP
